title: The Bachelorette Angie Kent is all smiles as she steps out in a frilly black ensemble
text:
The Bachelorette's Angie Kent looked like the cat that got the cream as she stepped out in Sydney on Wednesday.

The 29-year-old smiled from ear to ear while arriving at Channel 10's headquarters in Pyrmont just hours after announcing her debut book, If You Don't Laugh You'll Cry.

Angie showcased her slender frame in a black frilly crop top and matching mini skirt.

From The Bachelorette to the bookstore! Angie Kent beamed as she arrived at Channel 10's headquarters in Pyrmont, Sydney on Wednesday, just hours after announcing her debut book

Angie completed her look with a pair of heeled boots and a delicate silver ring worn on her left middle finger.

For makeup, she accentuated her features with a slick of pink lipstick, lashings of mascara and dewy peach-hued blush.

The former Gogglebox star styled her blonde hair loosely in a chic middle parting.

Stunning! Angie showcased her slender frame in a black frilly crop top and matching mini skirt

The sighting came hours after publishers Hachette Australia released information about Angie's upcoming autobiography.

'Angie believes everyone has a story and here she's sharing hers,' read a gushing press release.

'With her raw honesty and open heart, Angie takes a look at what really matters to help us all navigate life's big deals and tough times.

Primped to perfection! For makeup, she accentuated her features with a slick of pink lipstick, lashings of mascara and dewy peach-hued blush

'Get ready to laugh and cry in equal measure – and feel all the feels.'

Published by Hachette Australia, If You Don't Laugh You'll Cry will hit bookstores on November 12.

The Bachelorette continues Wednesday at 7:30pm on Channel 10

New venture: The sighting came hours after publishers Hachette Australia released information about Angie's upcoming autobiography, If You Don't Laugh You'll Cry
description: The Bachelorette's Angie Kent looked like the cat that got the cream as she stepped out in Sydney on Wednesday.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
